title: N.H. police investigating crash that ‘launched’ box truck into cluster of trees
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The driver was heading north on I-93 Saturday “when, for reasons that remain under investigation, he failed to negotiate a curve in the roadway,” officials said.
A Brockton man was injured Saturday morning when the truck he was driving crashed on Interstate 93 north in New Hampshire.

New Hampshire State Police By Abby Patkin September 16, 2025 | 3:57 PM 1 minute to read A Brockton man was injured Saturday morning when the box truck he was driving veered off Interstate 93 in New Hampshire and “launched” into a cluster of trees, according to officials.

title: Milford community reels after ICE temporarily detains local teen
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The teen’s family is still waiting for a decision on their asylum case.
Protesters rally against ICE enforcement actions after a 16 year-old was detained on Friday in Milford.
Jessica Rinaldi / The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Hoping to join Wu on ballot, third-place mayoral candidate pursues recount
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Politics Domingos DaRosa said he was hoping recounts would turn up enough votes to place him on the ballot in the wake of Josh Kraft's exit from the mayoral race.
Domingos DaRosa during a mayoral forum in May.

Mark Stockwell / The Boston Globe Domingos DaRosa, the community activist and Boston mayoral candidate who finished a distant third in last week’s preliminary election, is seeking a recount in order to have his name placed on the general election ballot in November.

title: Norfolk County sheriff spent campaign cash on personal business ventures, state officials say
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Politics Sheriff Patrick McDermott has agreed to pay tens of thousands of dollars to resolve the allegations.
Norfolk County Sheriff Patrick McDermott spent $31,705 out of his campaign to bolster his “personal business future," state campaign finance regulators said.

Stuart Cahill/Boston Herald, Pool By Abby Patkin September 16, 2025 | 3:10 PM 2 minutes to read Norfolk County Sheriff Patrick McDermott has agreed to pay a hefty civil forfeiture after state regulators determined he unlawfully spent tens of thousands of dollars in campaign funds to further his “personal business future.

title: Rob Gronkowski talks new Boston playground, slowing the partying

title: These Boston restaurants should have been on NYT best of lists, according to readers
author: Katelyn Umholtz
